EARS.description: Enable Asynchronous Request in Stop Register

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLNO.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFNO.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFYES.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

TCD%s_DLASTSGA.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

ERRCHN.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

VLD.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

SAST.description: Set All START Bits (activates all channels)

EDREQ_0.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 0.

EDREQ_1.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 1.

EDREQ_2.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 2.

EDREQ_3.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 3.

EDREQ_4.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 4

EDREQ_5.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 5

EDREQ_6.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 6

EDREQ_7.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 7

EDREQ_8.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 8

EDREQ_9.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 9

EDREQ_10.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 10

EDREQ_11.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 11

EDREQ_12.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 12

EDREQ_13.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 13

EDREQ_14.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 14

EDREQ_15.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 15

MLOFF.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

ELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete
Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

DLASTSGA.description: Destination last address adjustment or the memory address for the next transfer control descriptor to be loaded into this channel (scatter/gather)

INTMAJOR.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

INTHALF.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

MAJORELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

ELINK.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete
Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

MAXMB.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

IRMQ.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

IDLE.description: This bit indicates when CAN bus is in IDLE state

BUF0I.description: Buffer MB0 Interrupt Or Clear FIFO bit

BUF5I.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

BUF6I.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Warning"

BUF7I.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Overflow"

EACEN.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

TIME_STAMP.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

DLC.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

RTR.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

IDE.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

SRR.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

EXT.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

STD.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

PRIO.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

CTAR%s.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Master Mode)

CTAR_SLAVE.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Slave Mode)

RSER.description: DMA/Interrupt Request Select and Enable Register

PUSHR.description: PUSH TX FIFO Register In Master Mode

PUSHR_SLAVE.description: PUSH TX FIFO Register In Slave Mode

PCSIS.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

RFDF_DIRS.description: Receive FIFO Drain DMA or Interrupt Request Select

TFFF_DIRS.description: Transmit FIFO Fill DMA or Interrupt Request Select

PCS.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

DACINTC.description: DAC Interval Trigger n Control register

BB.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

DACINTC.description: DAC Interval Trigger n Control register

BB.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

DATAL.description: DATAL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

DATALL.description: CRCLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit DATA

DATALU.description: DATALL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

DATAH.description: DATAH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

DATAHL.description: DATAHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

DATAHU.description: DATAHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYL.description: POLYL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYLL.description: POLYLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYLU.description: POLYLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYH.description: POLYH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYHL.description: POLYHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYHU.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

WAS.description: Write CRC Data Register As Seed

FXOR.description: Complement Read Of CRC Data Register

FORCE_SEL.description: This read/write bit determines the source of the FORCE OUTPUT signal for this submodule.

SPLIT.description: Split the DBLPWM signal to PWMA and PWMB

LDFQ.description: These buffered read/write bits select the PWM load frequency

FRAC23_EN.description: Fractional Cycle Placement Enable for PWM_A

FRAC45_EN.description: Fractional Cycle Placement Enable for PWM_B

DTCNT0.description: The DTCNT0 field is interpreted differently depending on whether or not the fractional delays are being used (FRCNTRL[FRAC23_EN] is set)

DTCNT1.description: The DTCNT1 field is interpreted differently depending on whether or not the fractional delays are being used (FRCNTRL[FRAC45_EN] is set)

CAPTVAL0.description: This read-only register stores the value captured from the submodule counter

CVAL0CYC.description: This read-only register stores the cycle number corresponding to the value captured in CVAL0

CAPTVAL1.description: This read-only register stores the value captured from the submodule counter

CVAL1CYC.description: This read-only register stores the cycle number corresponding to the value captured in CVAL1

CAPTVAL2.description: This read-only register stores the value captured from the submodule counter

CVAL2CYC.description: This read-only register stores the cycle number corresponding to the value captured in CVAL2

CAPTVAL3.description: This read-only register stores the value captured from the submodule counter

CVAL3CYC.description: This read-only register stores the cycle number corresponding to the value captured in CVAL3

CAPTVAL4.description: This read-only register stores the value captured from the submodule counter

CVAL4CYC.description: This read-only register stores the cycle number corresponding to the value captured in CVAL4

CAPTVAL5.description: This read-only register stores the value captured from the submodule counter

CVAL5CYC.description: This read-only register stores the cycle number corresponding to the value captured in CVAL5

NOCOMB.description: No Combinational Path From Fault Input To PWM Output

DACBFRPBF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

DACBFRPTF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

DACBBIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

DACBTIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

FTM0FLT3.description: Selects the source of FTM0 fault 3

FTM0CFSEL.description: Carrier frequency selection for FTM0 output channel

FTM3CFSEL.description: Carrier frequency selection for FTM3 output channel

FTM1ICH0SRC.description: FTM1 channel 0 input capture source select

FTM1ICH1SRC.description: FTM1 channel 0 input capture source select

ENC.description: This bit controls the clock gate to the ENC module.

SYNCXBARAPITTRIG0.description: Synchronize XBARA's Input PIT Trigger 0 with fast clock

SYNCXBARAPITTRIG1.description: Synchronize XBARA's Input PIT Trigger 1 with fast clock

SYNCXBARAPITTRIG2.description: Synchronize XBARA's Input PIT Trigger 2 with fast clock

SYNCXBARAPITTRIG3.description: Synchronize XBARA's Input PIT Trigger 3 with fast clock

SYNCXBARBPITTRIG0.description: Synchronize XBARB's Input PIT Trigger 0 with fast clock

SYNCXBARBPITTRIG1.description: Synchronize XBARB's Input PIT Trigger 1 with fast clock

SYNCDACHWTRIG.description: Synchronize XBARA's output for DAC Hardware Trigger with flash/slow clock

SYNCEWMIN.description: Synchronize XBARA's output for EWM's ewm_in with flash/slow clock

SYNCCMP0SAMPLEWIN.description: Synchronize XBARA's output for CMP0's Sample/Window Input with flash/slow clock

SYNCCMP1SAMPLEWIN.description: Synchronize XBARA's output for CMP1's Sample/Window Input with flash/slow clock

SYNCCMP2SAMPLEWIN.description: Synchronize XBARA's output for CMP2's Sample/Window Input with flash/slow clock

SYNCCMP3SAMPLEWIN.description: Synchronize XBARA's output for CMP3's Sample/Window Input with flash/slow clock

SRPDN.description: NanoEdge Regulator 2.7V and 1.2V Supply Powerdown Control

SR27STDBY.description: NanoEdge Regulator 2.7 V Supply Standby Control

SR12STDBY.description: NanoEdge Regulator 1.2 V Supply Standby Control

ADCACH6SEL.description: ADCA MUX0 selection for ADCA channel 6

ADCACH7SEL.description: ADCA MUX1 selection for ADCA channel 7

ADCBCH6SEL.description: ADCB MUX1 selection for ADCB channel 6

ADCBCH7SEL.description: ADCB MUX1 selection for ADCB channel 7

STCTRLH.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register High

STCTRLL.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register Low

WDOGEN.description: Enables or disables the WDOG's operation

CLKSRC.description: Selects clock source for the WDOG timer and other internal timing operations.

IRQRSTEN.description: Used to enable the debug breadcrumbs feature

ALLOWUPDATE.description: Enables updates to watchdog write-once registers, after the reset-triggered initial configuration window (WCT) closes, through unlock sequence

DBGEN.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Debug mode.

STOPEN.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Stop mode.

WAITEN.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Wait mode.

TESTWDOG.description: Puts the watchdog in the functional test mode

TESTSEL.description: Effective only if TESTWDOG is set. Selects the test to be run on the watchdog timer.

BYTESEL.description: This 2-bit field selects the byte to be tested when the watchdog is in the byte test mode.

DISTESTWDOG.description: Allows the WDOG's functional test mode to be disabled permanently

TOVALHIGH.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

TOVALLOW.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

WINHIGH.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

WINLOW.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

WDOGUNLOCK.description: Writing the unlock sequence values to this register to makes the watchdog write-once registers writable again

TIMEROUTHIGH.description: Shows the value of the upper 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

TIMEROUTLOW.description: Shows the value of the lower 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

RSTCNT.description: Counts the number of times the watchdog resets the system

PRESCVAL.description: 3-bit prescaler for the watchdog clock source

XNE.description: Use Negative Edge of INDEX Pulse

XIP.description: INDEX Triggered Initialization of Position Counters UPOS and LPOS

SWIP.description: Software Triggered Initialization of Position Counters UPOS and LPOS

HNE.description: Use Negative Edge of HOME Input

HIP.description: Enable HOME to Initialize Position Counters UPOS and LPOS

WDOG.description: WDOG[15:0] is a binary representation of the number of clock cycles plus one that the watchdog timer counts before timing out and optionally generating an interrupt

POSD.description: This read/write register contains the position change in value occurring between each read of the position register

POSDH.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the value of the POSD register

REV.description: This read/write register contains the current value of the revolution counter.

REVH.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the value of the REV register.

POS.description: This read/write register contains the upper (most significant) half of the position counter
This read/write register contains the lower (least significant) half of the position counter

POSH.description: This read-only register contains a snapshot of the UPOS register.
This read-only register contains a snapshot of the LPOS register.

INIT.description: This read/write register contains the value to be used to initialize the upper half of the position counter (UPOS)
This read/write register contains the value to be used to initialize the lower half of the position counter (LPOS)

HOME.description: This is the raw HOME input.

INDEX.description: This is the raw INDEX input.

PHB.description: This is the raw PHASEB input.

PHA.description: This is the raw PHASEA input.

FHOM.description: This is the filtered version of HOME input.

FIND.description: This is the filtered version of INDEX input.

FPHB.description: This is the filtered version of PHASEB input.

FPHA.description: This is the filtered version of PHASEA input.

TEST_COUNT.description: These bits hold the number of quadrature advances to generate.

TEST_PERIOD.description: These bits hold the period of quadrature phase in IPBus clock cycles.

SABIE.description: Simultaneous PHASEA and PHASEB Change Interrupt Enable

SABIRQ.description: Simultaneous PHASEA and PHASEB Change Interrupt Request

MOD.description: This read/write register contains the upper (most significant) half of the modulus register
This read/write register contains the lower (least significant) half of the modulus register

COMP.description: This read/write register contains the upper (most significant) half of the position compare register
This read/write register contains the lower (least significant) half of the position compare register

SEL0.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT0 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL1.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT1 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL2.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT2 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL3.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT3 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL4.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT4 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL5.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT5 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL6.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT6 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL7.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT7 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL8.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT8 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL9.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT9 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

SEL10.description: Input (XBARA_INn) to be muxed to XBARA_OUT10 (refer to Functional Description section for input/output assignment)

BFCRT01%s.description: Boolean Function Term 0 and 1 Configuration Register for EVENTn

BFCRT23%s.description: Boolean Function Term 2 and 3 Configuration Register for EVENTn

RSLT%s.description: ADC Result Registers with sign extension

UNDEFINED.description: This read-only bitfield is undefined and will always contain random data.

PD0.description: Manual Power Down for Converter A

PD1.description: Manual Power Down for Converter B

SERVICE.description: The EWM service mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

COMPAREL.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum service time is required

COMPAREH.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum service time is required

ATCVH.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value High Register

ATCVL.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value Low Register

FCFTRIM.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

SCTRIM.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

SCFTRIM.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

FCTRIM.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

DMX32.description: DCO Maximum Frequency with 32.768 kHz Reference

LOLRE.description: PLL Loss of Lock Reset Enable

FLT.description: I2C Programmable Input Glitch Filter Register

SMB.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

SLTH.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register High

SLTL.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

SSIE.description: I2C Bus Stop or Start Interrupt Enable

RXEDGIE.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

LBKDIE.description: LIN Break Detect Interrupt or DMA Request Enable

RIE.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

TIE.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable.

RXEDGIF.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

TXDIR.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

RT.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

LBKDDMAS.description: LIN Break Detect DMA Select Bit

PARITYE.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error.

NOISY.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise.

LVDSC1.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 1 register

LVDSC2.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 2 register

RSTFLTSRW.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

RSTFLTSS.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

RSTFLTSEL.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

SSACKERR.description: Sticky Stop Mode Acknowledge Error Reset

ASC.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

AMC.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
